998548471241170944.text:
Great article @alexwsalter!
As described here, this is exactly why I think #Ethereum can shape a new territory, a new state, where law rules the money not bankers and governments.

https://hackernoon.com/ethereum-as-a-new-america-80785903bf9f …https://twitter.com/SoundMoneyProj/status/998530547893841921 …

998388600906665991.text: Paying "interest" just works as long as it is trustworthy and we  think it's payable. As soon as holders feel that the system can not grow anymore, this "hand brake" would be broken too.

998388599094763521.text: Do you lend your money to someone that has no work and no source of income and never will have just because he offer you a high interest rate!?

998388595907022848.text: "Paying interest" as a "parking brake" works in today monetary system because depositors/holders know that system is healthy and some borrower on the other side of balance sheet is doing some real economic activity which makes the "real interest" which can be shared with them.

998388593814097920.text:
Furthermore what they are suggesting as "bonds" will have much less power than "paying interest" in today monetary system.
Receiving interest is CERTAIN in today monetary system, but receiving interest because of holding these bonds is CONDITIONAL.

998388591180046336.text:
The only thing which is important in debt based system is time. With enough time total money supply can become ZERO when all loans settled.

But in Basis, they totally removed this main brake from the system and thought they can control the system just by offering interest.

998388589070290945.text: When money is created as #debt, money supply always fits its demand even if no one in market demand it. Such debt based system will not fail even if all the members decide to leave that by selling their tokens and buy another thing instead.

998388586520162306.text:
The main "brake" in the monetary system is that new money is being created as #debt.

As long as market has demand for that, it is created by paying new loans and when market demand falls, created money would be destroyed by loan settlement.

998388583756107776.text:
Buying "Bonds" instead of "Basis" is somehow like paying interest in today monetary system to decrease demand from the market.

But paying interest is just like a "parking brake". They implemented "parking brake" but they totally removed main "brake" from the #stabecoins car!

998388581122142208.text:
I'm agree that #Basis will fail @QWQiao
What made me disappointed about #Basis was that they totally removed creating new tokens as DEBT from system. Unlike @MakerDAO, It seems @basisprotocol designers completely missed the strong connection between #DEBT and #stability.https://twitter.com/QWQiao/status/998213023365042180 …

998198253027028992.text: A great article describing why libertarians prefer #stablecoins over #bitcoin by @QWQiaohttps://medium.com/@QwQiao/hayek-and-stablecoins-3c7f3291d728 …

997679857927643136.text:
Because #GOLD is suitable for someone who wants to "maximize profit" from storing value, but #Money is suitable for someone who wants to "minimize risk" in storing value.

It's why I think decentralized #stablecoins can bring 10x more customers to crypto market.

997679855713030144.text:
That huge amount of money is held by people who want to "store value" of their wealth in money.
Yeah #GOLD stores value too. But did you have ever asked yourself why do they prefer money over gold? Why gold market size is less than 1/10 of money market size? @kate_sills

997679852990926848.text: Main *purpose* of #money is not "to join two man together" exchanging something and transferring value. Even 1% of money in this 80 trillion money market isn't being used as "Medium of Exchange".https://twitter.com/kate_sills/status/993275143324495872 …

996343336058458112.text: It is not #mining that is making the #centralization! It is #market that is making pyramids everywhere!

995933656597311488.text:
Much has been written since the days of #Adam_Smith on the subject of money, and much useful investigation has been made, but we still hold to the old idea that #gold and silver are the only real #money and that all other forms of money are mere substitutes.
A. Mitchell Innes

988811521131208704.text: I just published “Ethereum as a New America” on @hackernoonhttps://hackernoon.com/ethereum-as-a-new-america-80785903bf9f …

986160624840437761.text: But in the economic world, #blockchain technology can easily eliminate the geographical constraints in governance and allow #minorities to follow the law they believe in.

986160622764163073.text: In the political world, only one single #rule is applicable to all people in a country. In #democratic governance, #majority of people determine that rule.

986160620960612353.text: But From #liberal perspective, #blockchain for #economy is better than #democracy for #politics.

986160618712510464.text: In both cases, we move to #RuleofLaw. Smart contracts are simple, clear, and comprehensive #law of #blockchain world written as computer programs.

986160616757964800.text: In both cases, we #Decentralize the power. Because we prefer to trust the majority vote rather than a single person's vote, albeit a great and trusted one.

986160614652497920.text:
The transformation that #blockchain brings to the #economy can be likened to moving from monarchy to the #democracy in the #political world.

@junseth @Frances_Coppola @bitstein @fernandoulrich
